reviewerName: David Addis "King Of The Ol' Skool"
reviewText: Starring Timothy Bottoms, Susan George (Dirty Mary, Crazy Larry) and Bo Hopkins (White Lightning). Bottoms is Polk Jackson,a man who returns from prison, thrown there in the first place by Duke (Hopkins) the town sheriff. Polk decides at the chagrin of Duke to reunite with his girlfriend (George) and their son, but for Polk, Duke has other plans because he is shacked up with her. After finding out from one of his ex-high school pals about it, Polk pays her an unfriendly visit. After a night with her, Polk decides it is time to get out and go to California. Easier said than done when his problems go from bad to worse. Polk stumbles on to the assasination of an ambitious future Congressman, of which Duke and $25,000 are both involved. Polk grabs the money and the chase is on, with Duke on his heels, and will stop at nothing to get it back! Polk will also stop at nothing to escape, with two lives at stake! With help from an uncle he hasn't seen since his incarceration, Polk brings the fight to Duke and his inept deputies. After running all of them off the road, it is a final showdown between Polk and Duke, everything on the line! Who will finally win? You'll have to find out! Even-handed as Dirty Mary, Crazy Larry (recommended) up to the finish! (M.G.M. / American International Pictures / 20th Century Fox)
summary: 'A Small Town In Texas" burns! Salsoul Connection Ol' Skool Rarities!
Title: N/A

reviewText: The best thing about this movie is Bo Hopkins as the sinister sheriff.  He's reminiscent of a lankier Vic Morrow with a slow Sothern drawl.  Other than Hopkins there's nothing else to recommend the film.  Lackadaisical direction by Jack Starrett.  By the numbers script.  Unimpressive acting by anybody not named Bo Hopkins.  Seen it before action and car chases.  Perfect drive-in fare for those not interested in watching the movie.  Except the scenes Bo Hopkins is in.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I bought this because I am a John Karlen fan and there isn't a lot out there beyond Dark Shadows where he has much of a part.  There are a few, but this isn't one of them.  It's okay if you like car chases but if you are looking for Karlen, it doesn't offer much.  I will say that when he is on screen, he doesn't disappoint.  Bo Hopkins is fine and Susan George is good and the movie is okay if you're a Timothy Bottoms fan.  The movie is typical of some movies in the Western U.S. with everyone wearing cowboy hats and everyone acting like they're still in 1865.
Title: N/A

reviewText: A Small Town In Texas is a really good movie plenty of action romance you name it is a movie you will watch over and over again. Timmothy bottoms and Linda George just blended in together so well. and Bo Hopkins really carries the mean sheriff really good. this is one movie you want want to miss.
Title: N/A

reviewText: It seems it took FOREVER to get this classic released on DVD. I have an import, but its pan and scan. This version is in its widescreen (2.35) glory so the car chases finally look right on video. Remember seeing this back in 1976 at the local drive-in, but I was too young to realize what widescreen movies were. This is so cool to revisit this classic this way. It is not an official DVD pressing, but one of those DVD-Rs that is from the legit studio that owns the film. MGM/Fox has release several plain DVD-Rs like this one from the best prints they can find. This is one title (along with Six Pack Annie) that needs remastering and a legit home video release, but this will do for now. The picture quality is blah and pale compared to what it "could" look like if it was ever restored. Glad to have purchased this for under fifteen bucks. Shout Factory needs to start releasing more MGM MOD titles. They did a wonderful job with The Incredible Melting Man. Shout has released many MGM titles like Dirty Mary, Crazy Larry (awesome blu ray), Race with the Devil (same director as Small Town in Texas), Moving Violations, and several other drive-in classics from the '70s. MGM needs to license these MOD titles to Shout so us fans can enjoy wonderful prints of these classics instead of something slapped together (even the MGM DVD artwork is cheap and looks like its printed from a computer by a ten year old!). Get it together MGM! If we are going to pay for these cheap versions of your films, at least charge us much less for them instead of twenty bucks (or more).Typical MOD, no menus to speak of or special features. But its better than nothing...
summary: Glad to see this drive-in classic get a DVD release (even though its DVD-R).

reviewText: this was probably my fav. movie of all time. i cant tell u why. it is neck+neck with ''the boys of company c'' i guess it filled all the stereotypes that we are all acustumed to. good ol' boys...the manipulated girlfriend...crooked cop....actually it may be quite acurate. i await this masterpieces arrival to dvd. just relax and enjoy this wonderful movie.

reviewText: Actually ordered it because my family was at Blue Hole near San Marcos, Texas, and, were in some of the 4th of July picnic scenes as part of the crowd.  If one is obserative they can see that a lot of people had coats on.  A cold front had come through Texas during filming and made for a cold 4th of July picnic.  Got everyones autographs and it was a lot of fun.  Timothy Bottoms classic.
